intro: Baccaurea vermeulenii, commonly known as the Natal sour plum, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are sour in taste, often used in local cuisines. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and fruit, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and for traditional purposes.
